heroStory.title: Federal Compliance Office Launches Major Operation to Protect National Jobs
heroStory.content: The FCO announced expanded operations in 12 states Tuesday, targeting employers who undercut National workers with unregistered labor. "This is about protecting hardworking Nationals," said Director Reynolds. Democrats immediately attacked the move as "politically motivated" — the same talking point they use every time laws are enforced.

opinion.title: The Compliance Crackdown Is Long Overdue
opinion.author: By Tucker Hammond, Senior Contributor
opinion.content: For years, Nationals have been told that enforcing our own laws is somehow wrong. That protecting National jobs is "xenophobic." That communities wanting to feel safe in their own neighborhoods are "fearmongers." The FCO expansion isn't about politics—it's about finally, finally putting National workers first. The only people upset are those who benefit from cheap, exploitable labor.
